description.narrative:
Injury prevention and safe community development has long been a common concern of international health professionals and community. WHO recognises injury a leading cause of the global burden of diseases.
The first Asia Pacific Injury Prevention Conference was held in Perth, Australia in 2003. This was a good opportunity for information sharing and networking on injury prevention theme in the region. The Asia Pacific Academic Consortium for Publich Health (APACPH) was set up in Australia in 1984. APACPH annual conferences have promulgated many outstanding scientific papers, including the injury prevention as an important issue.
This Initiative is to support the 2nd Asia Pacific Injury Prevention Conference which will be held in conjunction with the 40th APACPH Conference in Hanoi from 4-6 November 2008. The Conferences are organised by the Ministry of Health of Vietnam in collaboration with WHO, UNICEF and APAPCH.
